bill.title: Creating an affirmative defense to the crime of possession of a controlled substance for possession of certain medical treatments; amending podiatrist qualifications.
bill.description: Creating an affirmative defense to the crime of possession of a controlled substance for possession of certain medical treatments; amending podiatrist qualifications.

history.action: Senate Introduced
Senate Referred to Committee on Financial Institutions and Insurance
Senate Hearing: Tuesday, January 29, 2019, 9:30 AM Room 546-S
Senate Committee Report recommending bill be passed by Committee on Financial Institutions and Insurance
Senate Committee of the Whole - Be passed
Senate Final Action - Passed;  Yea: 40 Nay: 0
House Received and Introduced
House Referred to Committee on Insurance
House Hearing: Monday, March 11, 2019, 3:30 PM Room 212-N
House Committee Report recommending bill be passed as amended by Committee on Insurance
House Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted
House Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
House Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 123 Nay: 1
Senate Nonconcurred with amendments; Conference Committee requested; appointed Senator Olson , Senator Billinger and Senator Ware as conferees
House Motion to accede adopted;  Representative Vickrey,  Representative Cox and  Representative Neighbor appointed as conferees
Senate  Senator Suellentrop,  Senator Berger, and  Senator Bollier are appointed to replace  Senator Olson,  Senator Billinger, and  Senator Ware on the Conference Committee

House  Representative Patton,  Representative Ralph, and  Representative Carmichael are appointed to replace  Representative Vickrey,  Representative Cox, and  Representative Neighbor on the Conference Committee
House Conference committee report now available
House Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
House Conference Committee Report agree to disagree adopted;  Representative Patton,  Representative Ralph and  Representative Carmichael appointed as second conferees
Senate Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
Senate Conference Committee Report agree to disagree adopted;  Senator Suellentrop,  Senator Berger and  Senator Bollier appointed as second conferees
House Conference committee report now available
House Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
House Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 87 Nay: 36
Senate Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
Senate Motion to adopt Conference Committee Report
Senate Substitute motion to not adopt and appoint a new conference failed.
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 27 Nay: 8
Senate Enrolled and presented to Governor on Friday, May 10, 2019
Senate Approved by Governor on Monday, May 20, 2019

votes.desc: Senate Final Action - Passed - Yea: 40 Nay: 0
House Final Action - Passed as amended - Yea: 123 Nay: 1
House Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 87 Nay: 36
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 27 Nay: 8

calendar.description: Senate Financial Institutions and Insurance Hearing
